testcase.classname: To verify functionality and behaviour of GitHub search API based on series of keywords,
testcase.name: validate total number of repositories for given programming language created before 01st January 2011
testcase.system-out: Given I perform GET operation to validate total no of repo created before "2011-01-01" for given programming language 'language:java'.passed Then I should see the total count 16970 in response.........................passed

testcase.classname: To verify functionality and behaviour of GitHub search API based on series of keywords,
testcase.name: validate total number of repositories for given programming language created before 01st January 2011 2
testcase.system-out: Given I perform GET operation to validate total no of repo created before "2011-01-01" for given programming language 'language:c'.passed Then I should see the total count 13530 in response.........................passed

testcase.classname: To verify functionality and behaviour of GitHub search API based on series of keywords,
testcase.name: validate total number of repositories for given organisation and programming language with sort and order
testcase.system-out: Given I perform GET operation to validate total no of repo of 'org:workday' for 'language:java' with 'star' and 'desc'.passed Then I should see the total count 6 in response sorted by 'star' and order by 'desc'.passed

testcase.classname: To verify functionality and behaviour of GitHub search API based on series of keywords,
testcase.name: validate total number of repositories for given organisation and programming language with sort and order 2
testcase.system-out: Given I perform GET operation to validate total no of repo of 'org:github' for 'language:java' with 'star' and 'desc'.passed Then I should see the total count 4 in response sorted by 'star' and order by 'desc'.passed

testcase.classname: To verify functionality and behaviour of GitHub search API based on series of keywords,
testcase.name: validate total number of repositories for given user with sort by fork and in ascending order
testcase.system-out: Given I perform GET operation to validate total no of repo of 'user:deepak' with 'fork' and 'aesc'.passed Then I should see the total count 45 in response sorted by 'fork' and order by 'aesc' for given users.passed

testcase.classname: To verify functionality and behaviour of GitHub search API based on series of keywords,
testcase.name: validate total number of repositories for given user with sort by fork and in ascending order 2
testcase.system-out: Given I perform GET operation to validate total no of repo of 'user:john' with 'star' and 'aesc'.passed Then I should see the total count 24 in response sorted by 'star' and order by 'aesc' for given users.passed

testcase.classname: To verify functionality and behaviour of GitHub search API based on series of keywords,
testcase.name: validate 1st repositories for given user with sort by fork and in ascending order
testcase.system-out: Given I perform GET operation to validate total no of repo of 'user:deepak' with 'star' and 'aesc'.passed Then I should see the repo name 'chef_cookbooks' in response sorted by 'star' and order by 'aesc' for given users.passed

testcase.classname: To verify functionality and behaviour of GitHub search API based on series of keywords,
testcase.name: validate that all the fetched repositories for given organisation and language is public according to query param sorted by star and in ascending order
testcase.system-out: Given I perform GET operation to validate public repo of 'org:github's 'language:java' with 'star' and 'aesc'.passed Then I should see all the public repo and sorted by 'star' and order by 'aesc'.passed
